result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Lee Chapman Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Lee Chapman Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Lee Chapman Jr was found guilty of Resisting/Failing to Stop, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

Supervision fees
DNA Sample
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Lee Chapman Jr

records.addlTxt:
2:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Lee Chapman Jr in court.  Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Michael Lee Chapman Jr. 
Also calling 22CF72 and 22tr569,570,571,572.
Defendant waives preliminary hearings. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Magallones willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. 
Bail continued
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 11:45 am.
